hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 20-day rolling volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) while price consolidates within a 5% range for 10+ days, a breakout above the consolidation high on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals an imminent transition from NEUTRAL to BULL regime with 3-day momentum persistence.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression during neutral regimes represents pent-up energy. Breakouts on volume suggest institutional accumulation and regime change initiation. The 3-day persistence filter avoids false breakouts.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of 100-day volatility distribution
BTC price range (high-low) < 5% over last 10 trading days
BTC closes above consolidation high with volume > 1.5x 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain for 3 days OR leads to immediate reversal below consolidation range (>60% of occurrences).
